channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [WFLY-5543] Can't recover transaction started by MDB on WSMQ when RAR is deployed as an archive
item.description:
There is a problem with recovering transaction started by MDB pointing to a WSMQ JMS resource.

If I do so then the recovery process fails with [1]

WARN  [com.arjuna.ats.jta] (Periodic Recovery) ARJUNA016043: Exception on attempting to restore XAResource: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.ibm.mq.connector.xa.XARWrapper from [Module "org.jboss.jts:main" from local module loader @707f7052 (finder: local module finder @11028347 (roots: /home/ochaloup/jboss/jboss-eap-7.0.0.DR11-wsmq2/modules,/home/ochaloup/jboss/jboss-eap-7.0.0.DR11-wsmq2/modules/system/layers/base))]
 
 at org.jboss.modules.ModuleClassLoader.findClass(ModuleClassLoader.java:205)
 
 at org.jboss.modules.ConcurrentClassLoader.performLoadClassUnchecked(ConcurrentClassLoader.java:455)
 
 at org.jboss.modules.ConcurrentClassLoader.performLoadClassChecked(ConcurrentClassLoader.java:404)
 
 at org.jboss.modules.ConcurrentClassLoader.performLoadClass(ConcurrentClassLoader.java:385)
 
 at org.jboss.modules.ConcurrentClassLoader.loadClass(ConcurrentClassLoader.java:130)
 
 at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method)
 
 at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:348)
 
 at java.io.ObjectInputStream.resolveClass(ObjectInputStream.java:626)
 
 at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readNonProxyDesc(ObjectInputStream.java:1613)
 
 at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readClassDesc(ObjectInputStream.java:1518)
 
 at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readOrdinaryObject(ObjectInputStream.java:1774)
 
 at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readObject0(ObjectInputStream.java:1351)
 
 at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readObject(ObjectInputStream.java:371)
 
 at com.arjuna.ats.internal.jta.resources.arjunacore.XAResourceRecord.restore_state(XAResourceRecord.java:969)
 
 at com.arjuna.ats.arjuna.coordinator.BasicAction.restore_state(BasicAction.java:1118)
 
 at com.arjuna.ats.arjuna.coordinator.BasicAction.activate(BasicAction.java:488)
 
 at com.arjuna.ats.arjuna.coordinator.BasicAction.activate(BasicAction.java:451)
 
 at com.arjuna.ats.arjuna.recovery.RecoverAtomicAction.<init>(RecoverAtomicAction.java:50)
 
 at com.arjuna.ats.internal.arjuna.recovery.AtomicActionRecoveryModule.doRecoverTransaction(AtomicActionRecoveryModule.java:149)
 
 at com.arjuna.ats.internal.arjuna.recovery.AtomicActionRecoveryModule.processTransactionsStatus(AtomicActionRecoveryModule.java:253)
 
 at com.arjuna.ats.internal.arjuna.recovery.AtomicActionRecoveryModule.periodicWorkSecondPass(AtomicActionRecoveryModule.java:109)
 
 at com.arjuna.ats.internal.arjuna.recovery.PeriodicRecovery.doWorkInternal(PeriodicRecovery.java:793)
 
 at com.arjuna.ats.internal.arjuna.recovery.PeriodicRecovery.run(PeriodicRecovery.java:375)
 
 
 
WARN  [com.arjuna.ats.arjuna] (Periodic Recovery) ARJUNA012154: RecoverAtomicAction: transaction 0:ffff0a28048f:-470895ed:5624c495:34 not activated, unable to replay phase 2 commit. Check state has not already been completed.
 
InputObjectState Type  : /StateManager/BasicAction/TwoPhaseCoordinator/AtomicAction
 
InputObjectState Size  : 7204
 
InputObjectState Buffer: )
 
WARN  [com.arjuna.ats.arjuna] (Periodic Recovery) ARJUNA012379: ExpiredTransactionScanner - 0:ffff0a28048f:-470895ed:5624c495:34 is assumed complete and will be moved.

This means that instead of commiting the unfinished transaction the txn log is put to expired part of txn object store and the transaction on wsmq broker side is left in-doubt.

I'm attaching my configuration file.

[1] trace level on transaction manager log category

WARN  [com.arjuna.ats.jta] (Periodic Recovery) ARJUNA016043: Exception on attempting to restore XAResource: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.ibm.mq.connector.xa.XARWrapper from [Module "org.jboss.jts:main" from local module loader @707f7052 (finder: local module finder @11028347 (roots: /home/ochaloup/jboss/jboss-eap-7.0.0.DR11-wsmq2/modules,/home/ochaloup/jboss/jboss-eap-7.0.0.DR11-wsmq2/modules/system/layers/base))]
 
 at org.jboss.modules.ModuleClassLoader.findClass(ModuleClassLoader.java:205)
 
 at org.jboss.modules.ConcurrentClassLoader.performLoadClassUnchecked(ConcurrentClassLoader.java:455)
 
 at org.jboss.modules.ConcurrentClassLoader.performLoadClassChecked(ConcurrentClassLoader.java:404)
 
 at org.jboss.modules.ConcurrentClassLoader.performLoadClass(ConcurrentClassLoader.java:385)
 
 at org.jboss.modules.ConcurrentClassLoader.loadClass(ConcurrentClassLoader.java:130)
 
 at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method)
 
 at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:348)
 
 at java.io.ObjectInputStream.resolveClass(ObjectInputStream.java:626)
 
 at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readNonProxyDesc(ObjectInputStream.java:1613)
 
 at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readClassDesc(ObjectInputStream.java:1518)
 
 at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readOrdinaryObject(ObjectInputStream.java:1774)
 
 at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readObject0(ObjectInputStream.java:1351)
 
 at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readObject(ObjectInputStream.java:371)
 
 at com.arjuna.ats.internal.jta.resources.arjunacore.XAResourceRecord.restore_state(XAResourceRecord.java:969)
 
 at com.arjuna.ats.arjuna.coordinator.BasicAction.restore_state(BasicAction.java:1118)
 
 at com.arjuna.ats.arjuna.coordinator.BasicAction.activate(BasicAction.java:488)
 
 at com.arjuna.ats.arjuna.coordinator.BasicAction.activate(BasicAction.java:451)
 
 at com.arjuna.ats.arjuna.recovery.RecoverAtomicAction.<init>(RecoverAtomicAction.java:50)
 
 at com.arjuna.ats.internal.arjuna.recovery.AtomicActionRecoveryModule.doRecoverTransaction(AtomicActionRecoveryModule.java:149)
 
 at com.arjuna.ats.internal.arjuna.recovery.AtomicActionRecoveryModule.processTransactionsStatus(AtomicActionRecoveryModule.java:253)

WARN  [com.arjuna.ats.arjuna] (Periodic Recovery) ARJUNA012154: RecoverAtomicAction: transaction 0:ffff0a28048f:-470895ed:5624c495:34 not activated, unable to replay phase 2 commit. Check state has not already been completed.

item.summary: Can't recover transaction started by MDB on WSMQ when RAR is deployed as an archive

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Attaching forgotten files that could help in reproducing

The fact that it ends up here: https://github.com/jbosstm/narayana/blob/master/ArjunaJTA/jta/classes/com/arjuna/ats/internal/jta/resources/arjunacore/XAResourceRecord.java#L969

Suggests to me that an XAResourceRecoveryHelper was not registered here: https://github.com/jbosstm/narayana/blob/master/ArjunaJTA/jta/classes/com/arjuna/ats/internal/jta/recovery/arjunacore/XARecoveryModule.java#L92

What do you think Michael Musgrove ?
/cc Jesper Pedersen

The other way how to reproduce this issue should be possible to use our crash recovery testsuite

. git clone http://git.app.eng.bos.redhat.com/git/jbossqe-eap-tests-transactions.git
. unignoring method commitHaltAtPhaseBeginning of file eap-tests-transactions/jbossts/src/test/java/org/jboss/as/test/jbossts/crashrec/test/JMSMdbCrashRecoveryTestCase.java
. cloning rar archive and configuration for WSMQ testing git clone -b eap7 http://git.app.eng.bos.redhat.com/git/jbossqe/eap-tests-wsmq.git
. cd jbossqe-eap-tests-transactions
. download jboss eap (http://download.devel.redhat.com/devel/candidates/JBEAP/JBEAP-7.0.0.DR12/jboss-eap-7.0.0.DR12.zip) or get the WFLY10
export JBOSS_HOME=path/to/eap/or/wfly

Now for executing a test each time these steps needs to be done
. copying wsmq resources under target directory for have them prepared
rm -rf jbossts/target && mkdir -p jbossts/target && cp -r ~/jms/eap-tests-wsmq jbossts/target/
. execution of the testcase pointing to a WebSphere instance in our lab
mvn verify -Dtest=JMSMdbCrashRecoveryTestCase#commitHaltAtPhaseBeginning -Djbossts.noJTS -Dmessaging.remote -Dibmmq.remote -Dno.cleanup.at.teardown=true
you should be able to see configuration and logs under jbossts/target/jbossas-jbossts/standalone/...

Hi Ondra,

I follow your steps but get the failure.

Running org.jboss.as.test.jbossts.crashrec.test.JMSMdbCrashRecoveryTestCase
 
Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 9.216 sec <<< FAILURE! - in org.jboss.as.test.jbossts.crashrec.test.JMSMdbCrashRecoveryTestCase
 
commitHaltAtPhaseBeginning(org.jboss.as.test.jbossts.crashrec.test.JMSMdbCrashRecoveryTestCase)  Time elapsed: 8.379 sec  <<< ERROR!
 
java.lang.RuntimeException: IBM MQ needs special container handling. You need to run JMSCrashRecoveryRemoteTestCase instead of this testcase
 
	at org.jboss.as.test.jbossts.base.setup.JMSSetup.getSetupTaskHandler(JMSSetup.java:59)

Hi Amos,

ah, sorry, I put down here wrong testcase class to be run. The steps should be rather this

  • rm -rf jbossts/target && mkdir -p jbossts/target && cp -r ~/jms/eap-tests-wsmq jbossts/target/
  • mvn verify -am -pl jbossts -DfailIfNoTests=false -Dtest=JMSMdbCrashRecoveryRemoteTestCase#commitHaltAtPhaseBeginning -Djbossts.noJTS -Dmessaging.remote -Dibmmq.remote -Dno.cleanup.at.teardown=true

I hope it will work now

anyway, I can reproduce the failure by using the standalone-full.wmq.xml and the tx-object-store.zip.

It looks like it can not find the class com.ibm.mq.connector.xa.XARWrapper and I think it should be in the wmq.jmsra.rar/com.ibm.mq.connector.jar

Amos Feng that was the only point which I was able to find out. The resource adapter contains the jar and the jar contains the XARWrapper but from some reason it's (probably) not on classpath for jts.
Later on I was just trying to hack the classpath by creating a new arbitrary module which contains such specific class and link such module to jts one. Unfortunately and probably logically I started to get NoSuchMethodException or something similar where I indicated that I'm clashing two classloaders - from archive and from module. Nevertheless I haven't got to any conclusion and this was just a try what would happen.
yeah, I think that we had met the similar problem before and I'm searching

I think the issue is that https://github.com/jbosstm/narayana/blob/master/ArjunaJTA/jta/classes/com/arjuna/ats/internal/jta/recovery/arjunacore/XARecoveryModule.java#L92 is maybe not called for this RAR. I don't think it is ever expected that loading from https://github.com/jbosstm/narayana/blob/master/ArjunaJTA/jta/classes/com/arjuna/ats/internal/jta/resources/arjunacore/XAResourceRecord.java#L969 would ever work in app server and the fact that it reaches that line suggests the recovery helper was not registered.

I run the test and it does not throw any exception or failure. It looks like OK. 

-------------------------------------------------------
 
 T E S T S
 
-------------------------------------------------------
 
Running org.jboss.as.test.jbossts.crashrec.test.JMSMdbCrashRecoveryRemoteTestCase
 
Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 128.847 sec - in org.jboss.as.test.jbossts.crashrec.test.JMSMdbCrashRecoveryRemoteTestCase
 
 
 
Results :
 
 
 
Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0

So is this the expect result ? and I test it with the wildfly-10.0.0.CR4-SNAPSHOT

Hi Amos,

I'm sorry for a bit later response. Yes, it would be expected result if the behavior of test would not be caused by issue in test

I put the steps wrong here. As test method commitHaltAtPhaseBeginning was arbitrarily added to eap-tests-transactions/jbossts/src/test/java/org/jboss/as/test/jbossts/crashrec/test/JMSMdbCrashRecoveryTestCase.java I left it empty. For the test would be really run it's needed to delete the test whole test method from the class. I'm sorry for this wrong. I've written the steps on top of my head and missed this fact.

Then the test result would be

------------------------------------------------------- 
 
T E S T S
 
-------------------------------------------------------
 
Running org.jboss.as.test.jbossts.crashrec.test.JMSMdbCrashRecoveryRemoteTestCase
 
Tests run: 1, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 166.712 sec <<< FAILURE! - in org.jboss.as.test.jbossts.crashrec.test.JMSMdbCrashRecoveryRemoteTestCase
 
commitHaltAtPhaseBeginning(org.jboss.as.test.jbossts.crashrec.test.JMSMdbCrashRecoveryRemoteTestCase)  Time elapsed: 165.167 sec  <<< FAILURE!
 
java.lang.AssertionError:  - required maximum call count 0 but was 1
 
        at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)
 
        at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:41)
 
        at org.jboss.byteman.contrib.dtest.InstrumentedInstance.assertMethodCallCount(InstrumentedInstance.java:93)
 
        ...
 
Results :
 
 
 
Failed tests: 
  JMSMdbCrashRecoveryRemoteTestCase>TestBaseCrashRecovery.commitHaltAtPhaseBeginning:346->TestBaseCrashRecovery.commitHaltTest:432  - required maximum call count 0 but was 1
 
 
 
Tests run: 1, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0
 
 
 
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

You can check the test log under target/jbossas-jbossts/standalone/log/*.log and find word kill. This is the place where server jvm was killed and right after that time the server is restarted again. Then the recovery manager is started and you can see the exception of "class loading".

WARN  [com.arjuna.ats.jta] (Periodic Recovery) ARJUNA016043: Exception on attempting to restore XAResource: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.ibm.mq.connector.xa.XARWrapper

I agree with Tom and it looks like the transaction subsystem can not access the class in the RAR. So it needs to create such an ibm mq subsystem as Ondra had tried and register a recovery helper as we do such a thing in the HQ.

or is there any way to add the RAR class path in the deployment processor with the transaction subsystem ?

Doesn't JCA register the helpers normally? Jesper Pedersen and Stefano Maestri?

Amos, are you sure the helper is not registered? (As in, did you break point it and see it not called?)

There are no XAResourceRecoveryHelper's for JCA deployments. Recovery must be based on the classloader of the XAResource.

See JCA 1.7 Sec 6.5.3.5 / 7.6.2.8 / 13.5.2 / 15.4.3 / 15.4.4 for requirements.

Amos Feng I'm not sure with this but I think that creating a new module that the transaction module org.jboss.jts would depend on is not the correct way. From my side it was just a hacking to see what could be done. Such configuration would broke patching procedure for EAP CP releases at least. I think that the recovery system could be able to touch the classes in rar directly.

As a speculation - maybe some classloading issue in WSMQ RAR? I run the same testcase with JBoss AMQ6 product (ActiveMQ 5). AMQ rar is deployed as archive (the same way how it's done for wsmq rar) and the test case works.

Ondra Chaloupka, are you able to provide the steps to run with AMQ6 please? I would be interested for Amos to find out if it calls our recovery helper registration somehow. I think the recovery helper registration mechanism is designed to assist in these classloader issues.

Yes, sure. This would be steps

  • download JBoss AMQ from http://download.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/released/JBossAMQ/6.2.0/jboss-a-mq-6.2.0.redhat-133.zip
  • unzip it to some location
  • first time when run use -Dactivemq.remote.start to start amq karaf process. that will be left started and next time omit this parameter
    • first time run the test like mvn clean verify -am -pl jbossts -DfailIfNoTests=false -Dtest=JMSMdbCrashRecoveryRemoteTestCase#commitHaltAtPhaseBeginning -Djbossts.noJTS -Dmessaging.remote -Dactivemq.remote -Dactivemq.distro.fullpath=path/to/jboss-a-mq-6.2.0.redhat-133 -Dno.cleanup.at.teardown -Dactivemq.remote.start
    • when karaf process is already started then the test could be run mvn clean verify -am -pl jbossts -DfailIfNoTests=false -Dtest=JMSMdbCrashRecoveryRemoteTestCase#commitHaltAtPhaseBeginning -Djbossts.noJTS  -Dmessaging.remote -Dactivemq.remote -Dactivemq.distro.fullpath=path/to/jboss-a-mq-6.2.0.redhat-133 -Dno.cleanup.at.teardown

Jesper Pedersen mentioned that the documentation https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-US/JBoss_Enterprise_Application_Platform/6.4/html/Administration_and_Configuration_Guide/Deploy_the_WebSphere_MQ_Resource_Adapter.html says that resource adapter needs to be repacked to contain file mqetclient.jar. I have to admit that rar archive that we use does not contain that. But I have tried the run with the repacked rar archive and there is no change in behavior. I rather think that there is an issue in our documentation.

In case that the file com.ibm.mqetclient.jar would be needed it could be find in repository http://git.app.eng.bos.redhat.com/git/jbossqe-eap-tests-transactions.git under branch master.

What I can say XA transactions works fine for outbound connection, even recovery, even withouth mqetclient.jar. The troubles came when MDB is in play. Non-MDB scenario is the same just there is only ejb bean sending messages to a queue and jvm is crashed at some point of time

rm -rf jbossts/target && mkdir -p jbossts/target && cp -r ~/jms/eap-tests-wsmq jbossts/target/
 
mvn verify -am -pl jbossts -DfailIfNoTests=false  -Dtest=JMSCrashRecoveryRemoteTestCase#commitHaltAtPhaseBeginning -Djbossts.noJTS  -Dmessaging.remote -Dibmmq.remote -Dno.cleanup

The same trouble happens for the MDB scenario when WSMQ 8 is used. There is the same class loading issue

rm -rf jbossts/target && mkdir -p jbossts/target && cp -r ~/jms/eap-tests-wsmq jbossts/target/
 
mvn verify -am -pl jbossts -DfailIfNoTests=false  -Dtest=JMSMdbCrashRecoveryRemoteTestCase#commitHaltAtPhaseBeginning -Djbossts.noJTS  -Dmessaging.remote -Dibmmq.remote -Dibmmq8 -Dno.cleanup

It's probably only coincidence but we have another issue with MDB where rar does not provide enough information to recovery to finish txn: issue https://issues.jboss.org/browse/JBEAP-1497

Thanks Ondra, I can run the no-MDB test successfully and reproduce the failure of MDB test. I just set the TRACE logger of "com.arjuna" and "org.jboss.jca" and "org.jboss.as.connector" to get more details.

But I can not work with the activemq and get the failure.

Running org.jboss.as.test.jbossts.crashrec.test.JMSMdbCrashRecoveryRemoteTestCase
 
Tests run: 1, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 107.34 sec <<< FAILURE! - in org.jboss.as.test.jbossts.crashrec.test.JMSMdbCrashRecoveryRemoteTestCase

Hi Amos,

ah, yes, I didn't mentioned that. This is expected as there is another issue which causes the MDB testcases does not finish with success. The thing is that recovery is sucessfully started and run fine but the outcome of it is limited by issue https://issues.jboss.org/browse/WFLY-5536.

You can try to run instead of commitHaltAtPhaseBeginning testcase commitHaltAtPhaseBeginningMdb which is expected to pass.

ActiveMQ

mvn clean verify -am -pl jbossts -DfailIfNoTests=false -Dtest=JMSMdbCrashRecoveryRemoteTestCase#commitHaltAtPhaseBeginningMdb -Djbossts.noJTS  -Dmessaging.remote -Dactivemq.remote -Dactivemq.distro.fullpath=/home/ochaloup/tmp/jboss-a-mq-6.2.0.redhat-133 -Dno.cleanup.at.teardown [-Dactivemq.remote.start]

IBM MQ

rm -rf jbossts/target && mkdir -p jbossts/target && cp -r <path/to/wsmq-testsuite>/eap-tests-wsmq jbossts/target/
 
mvn verify -am -pl jbossts -DfailIfNoTests=false -Dtest=JMSMdbCrashRecoveryRemoteTestCase#commitHaltAtPhaseBeginningMdb -Djbossts.noJTS  -Dmessaging.remote -Dibmmq.remote -Dno.cleanup.at.teardown
Hi Ondra Chaloupka, is this a regression? Did something change from EAP 6.4? If it worked on 6.4 please can you pass the commands to run it on 6.4 so we can compare what is happening?

Hi Tom,

unfortunatelly I'm not able to say right now how this is working with EAP 6.4. I need to check how to easily run current testsuite against the old EAP version.

The problem to say if this is a regression or not is that for EAP 6.4 I've been running the RAR deployed as module. But RAR deployed as module is no more supported and the only correct way how to deploy RAR is using archive in EAP 7. I haven't been doing that in EAP 6.4.

I will try to let you know later today how to run the testsuite with rar deployed as archive against 6.4.

Ondra
Thanks Ondra

Hi Tom,

I've checked the behavior in 6.4 and from my experience it behaves in the same wrong way. Which would mean from what I can say that recovery does not work for MDB when rar is deployed as archive even in 6.4.

This is how I've run our testsuite on eap 6.4

rm -rf jbossts/target && mkdir -p jbossts/target && cp -r <path/to/wsmq/testsuite>/eap-tests-wsmq jbossts/target/
 
mvn verify -am -pl jbossts -DfailIfNoTests=false  -Djbossts.noJTS  -Dmessaging.remote -Dibmmq.remote -Dno.cleanup.at.teardown=true -Djboss.dist=/home/ochaloup/jboss/jboss-eap-6.4.0.GA -Dnode0.eap6 -Dtest=JMSMdbCrashRecoveryRemoteTestCase#commitHaltAtPhaseBeginningMdb
When a rar is deployed, can it be added to the classpath of the transaction service?

I have added JCA as this seems particular to JCA resource adapters. Does anyone know why the deploy as module was removed and whether that used to register XAResourceRecoveryHelpers?
/cc Stefano Maestri Jesper Pedersen

The expected thing from an integration point of view is something (I expect JCA) is meant to call https://github.com/jbosstm/narayana/blob/master/ArjunaJTA/jta/classes/com/arjuna/ats/internal/jta/recovery/arjunacore/XARecoveryModule.java#L92

Did the old deploy as module work like that?

Thanks Jesper - so it seems like one of these https://github.com/jbosstm/jboss-transaction-spi/blob/master/src/main/java/org/jboss/tm/XAResourceRecovery.java is not being provided to the transaction server somehow? As I mentioned earlier, its not expected that the transaction manager would reach: https://github.com/jbosstm/narayana/blob/master/ArjunaJTA/jta/classes/com/arjuna/ats/internal/jta/resources/arjunacore/XAResourceRecord.java#L969 within WFLY, the helper should have been passed in by JCA using XAResourceRecoveryRegistry (I imagine).

Amos, do we know if https://github.com/jbosstm/jboss-transaction-spi/blob/master/src/main/java/org/jboss/tm/XAResourceRecoveryRegistry.java#L61 is being called for this resource adapter?

Ah, Michael Musgrove I see. Inside EAP I don't think we should be using serialized XAResources for WebSphere MQ - especially if it does register a org.jboss.tm.XAResourceRecovery.

So it seems that https://github.com/jbosstm/narayana/blob/master/ArjunaJTA/jta/classes/com/arjuna/ats/internal/jta/resources/arjunacore/XAResourceRecord.java#L868 could be wrapped by a config option. Or if deserialize fails we could move on to trying https://github.com/jbosstm/narayana/blob/master/ArjunaJTA/jta/classes/com/arjuna/ats/internal/jta/resources/arjunacore/XAResourceRecord.java#L992

Amos Feng, the addXAResourceRecovery breakpoint is https://github.com/jbosstm/narayana/blob/master/ArjunaJTS/integration/src/main/java/com/arjuna/ats/jbossatx/jta/RecoveryManagerService.java#L80

Tom Jenkinson There are two XAResourceRecoveryHelper added

org.jboss.as.ejb3.remote.EJBTransactionRecoveryService@4db4f099
 
org.jboss.jca.core.tx.jbossts.XAResourceRecoveryImpl@4020e1ae
Tom Jenkinson it looks like the failure happens in the AtomicActionRecoveryModule.periodicWorkSecondPass but not the XARecoveryModule

Amos Feng - sure, XARM loads the XAR for the AARM to use during its cycle - i.e. they are coupled.

Amos Feng - re the helpers - I would need more details to know that the org.jboss.jca.core.tx.jbossts.XAResourceRecoveryImpl@4020e1ae relates to.

Jesper Pedersen - thanks! That should be a test issue then. Ondra Chaloupka - please can you configure a <recovery> connection as per the reference to WebSphere connection configuration that Jesper provided and see what the outcome is then?

Tom Jenkinson - yeap, I will look at it and let you know. My humble expectation is that this will not be the cause of the problem. I think that the <recovery> element being set with username and password directly works fine. The reason why we changed the documentation for security manager was edge cases where JCA is not able to cope with empty password in recovery element. In such case the security domain is necessary. Nevertheless, sure I will change the settings to follow the documentation.

What I've noticed when debugging - the class not found exception came from EJBXAResourceDeserializer from XAResourceRecord at https://github.com/jbosstm/narayana/blob/master/ArjunaJTA/jta/classes/com/arjuna/ats/internal/jta/resources/arjunacore/XAResourceRecord.java#L961. It kind of seemed that the deserializer should know what to do but it can't find the class. That’s just my two cents.

The hypothesis is that based on Jespers reference the RAR also needs a recovery connection configured in standalone.xml. By doing that an appropriate https://github.com/jbosstm/jboss-transaction-spi/blob/master/src/main/java/org/jboss/tm/XAResourceRecovery.java can be registered by JCA. The RAR then does not provide the recovery connection, it is the recovery connection defined in the standalone.xml.

Ondra Chaloupka thinking about it now though, we probably still have an issue as the XAResource is serializable so we may need a way to turn that off because the error will likely be the same so probably not worth a retest at this stage. Amos Feng, what I think you need to do is add a recovery connection into the standalone.xml but also try disabling XAResource serialization in XAResourceRecord (or at least fallback to trying https://github.com/jbosstm/narayana/blob/master/ArjunaJTA/jta/classes/com/arjuna/ats/internal/jta/resources/arjunacore/XAResourceRecord.java#L992 if you get a CNFE when reading the object https://github.com/jbosstm/narayana/blob/master/ArjunaJTA/jta/classes/com/arjuna/ats/internal/jta/resources/arjunacore/XAResourceRecord.java#L969.
Agreed, I was meaning for testing. At least one thing in the application server uses the deserializer process (I think its JBoss remoting).

         </recover-credential>
 
 </recovery>

Tom Jenkinson this doesn't look like a 10 blocker to me, based on the current details. Let me know ASAP if you believe this to be a blocker (just upgrade the status or message me)
Michael Musgrove Forgot Tom is out this week, can you tell me if you feel this is a blocker?
Jason Greene Agreed - I spoke with Ondra Chaloupka and he thinks it is not a blocker for WFLY too (but it is for EAP7) so dropping the priority to Major is fine.
The fix of JBTM-2550 should be in the narayana 5.2.8.Final
The similar errors is still shown for JTS

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. start server with configuration pointing to WSMQ
  2. start receiving data from MDB and enlist one more resource to get XA doing 2PC
  3. crash jvm server at the start of commit phase of 2PC
  4. restart the server and see the warning

The exception should be seen when attached transaction log with unfinished transaction and xml configuration and the rar is used.

  1. unzip the txn log to have directory structure like $JBOSS_HOME/standalone/data/tx-object-store/ShadowNoFileLockStore/...
  2. copy standalone-full.wsq.xml to $JBOSS_HOME/standalone/configuration
  3. copy rar archive to $JBOSS_HOME/standalone/deployments
  4. run server like ./bin/standalone.sh -c standalone-full.wmq.xml
  5. after start you can see the exception
